From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin praesūmere, with normal change of conjugation to -ir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [pɾə.zuˈmi]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [pɾe.zuˈmiɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Homophone: presumí
  • Rhymes: -i(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

presumir (first-person singular present presumeixo or presumo, first-person singular preterite presumí, past participle presumit) (ambitransitive)

  1. to presume, assume
  2. to boast, show off

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • presumpció

Further reading

[edit]
  • “presumir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “presumir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “presumir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “presumir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesūmere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pɾe.zuˈmi(ʁ)/ [pɾe.zuˈmi(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pɾe.zuˈmi(ʁ)/ [pɾe.zuˈmi(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /pɾe.zuˈmi(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /pɾe.zuˈmi(ʁ)/ [pɾe.zuˈmi(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /pɾe.zuˈmi(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɾɨ.zuˈmiɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɾɨ.zuˈmiɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /pɾɨ.zuˈmi.ɾi/

Verb

[edit]

presumir (first-person singular present presumo, first-person singular preterite presumi, past participle presumido)

  1. (ambitransitive) to presume, assume

Related terms

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin praesūmere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pɾesuˈmiɾ/ [pɾe.suˈmiɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: pre‧su‧mir

Verb

[edit]

presumir (first-person singular present presumo, first-person singular preterite presumí, past participle presumido)

  1. (transitive) to presume
  2. (intransitive) to boast, to brag, to show off
    Synonym: fanfarronear

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of presumir (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
